string_table.string: To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.
Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.

search.slidetext: how can you craft your message to recruit great candidates? select next to begin. dynamic messaging for vista recruitment this course contains audio.

select each marker to learn more about the navigation elements of the player. to exit this course at any time, close this browser window. select next to continue. next/prev advance to the next or previous screen within the course. accessibility options adjust additional accessibility options. audio adjust the volume of the course or screen. refresh refreshes current screen. playbar playbar displays length of the current screen. play/pause play or pause the course using this button. collapse/expand collapse or expand the left hand pane. current screen view current screen within the main menu. transcript transcript opens a written version of the audio narration. menu menu opens an outline of course sections and offers the ability to navigate within the course.
welcome to dynamic messaging for vista recruitment! in this course, you will learn about messaging strategies to use to successfully recruit qualified vista members. vista member recruitment
this course will help you: craft an effective recruitment message, attract great potential applicants, and find the right candidate for your vista project. building your understanding

kai is a first time vista sponsor working at telegraph community food bank in oakland, california. kai needs guidance to create successful recruitment messaging that will help him find the best vista candidates for his project. meet vista sponsor kai

to attract qualified candidates, vista sponsors like kai can take three actions: select each image to learn more. vista recruitment messaging create a recruitment message that showcasesthe vista project create a recruitment message that showcasesthe vista project create a recruitment message that showcasesthe vista project tailor the recruitment message to differentformats and audiences tailor the recruitment message to differentformats and audiences tailor the recruitment message to differentformats and audiences tailor the recruitment message to differentformats and audiences ensure the recruitment message reaches a diverse pool of candidates ensure the recruitment message reaches a diverse pool of candidates ensure the recruitment message reaches a diverse pool of candidates ensure the recruitment message reaches a diverse pool of candidates

x x x x x x a screenshot of a webpage is shown. side menus are shown, but are not the emphasis. the text reads: college access coordinator - richmond promise launched in january 2016, the richmond promise is a community-wide college scholarship fund and college success initiative to build a college graduating culture in richmond, ca. the richmond promise scholarship is made possible by a 10-year. $35 millon seed-investment from the chevron corporation's environmental and community investment agreement with the city of richmond. the richmond promise is a 501c3 charitable organization with institutional partnerships with the city of richmond, wccusd, contra costa college. university of california and california state university systems. mission: we see a day when all children in richmond have access to high quality education, excel from high school to higher education, attain a postsecondary degree or certification, thrive in the field of their choice, and become a leader of positive change in their community and the world. goals: increase the number of students, particularly who are low-income and first in their family to go to college, who: 1. are exposed to college resources, role models, and experiences throughout k-16 2. successfully transition to an accredited university/college directly from high school 3. successfully transfer from community college to 4-year university 4. complete an associates degree, bachelor's degree, or career + technical education further help on this page can be found by clicking here. member duties: the vista team will work collaboratively to build capacity and advance the mission of the richmond promise. they will support the development of an effective outreach strategy that aims to increase awareness and access to the richmond promise scholarship and build a college-graduation culture throughout the city of richmond while prioritizing equity and inclusion for underrepresented communities. the vista members will also help to develop and manage college awareness programming at the k-12 level, including financial aid access and college-going conversations with richmond youth. additionally, they will work to engage parents in the community to build a parent volunteer wing that supports the college aspirations of all richmond's youth, regardless of background or identity. the team will develop a communications and outreach plan that promotes financial aid awareness and access among all richmond parents and families, particularly those who have been historically underserved. they will work to build sustainable community-based institutional partnerships with schools. community-based organizations, and other stakeholders within the richmond community. these partnerships will help develop a comprehensive financial aid campaign that increases access to state and federal dollars for college, particularly for marginalized and underrepresented groups. showcase your vista project vista sponsors are required to submit service opportunity listings in egrants to recruit applicants for their vista projects. using the information provided in the service opportunity listings is a great place to start developing recruitment messages. select the underlined text to review a sample.

to be eligible for this unique opportunity, you must be at least 18 years old and a us citizen, national, or legal resident. you must also be able to successfully complete a background investigation. join us in our mission to end hunger and promote food justice. to learn more about our organization and apply for this opportunity, please visit my americorps. in addition to making a meaningful impact, vista members with telegraph community food bank will gain valuable skills and experience in community engagement and nonprofit management. this is a great opportunity to build your resume, develop your leadership skills, and make a lasting impact on your community. you will have the opportunity to make a real impact in our community, and your tasks will include expanding our food distribution network and raising awareness about hunger and food insecurity in oakland. located in the heart of oakland, california, telegraph community food bank is a nonprofit organization committed to ending hunger in our community. we achieve our mission by providing nutritious meals to families and individuals in need. identify important details about your program the service opportunity listing can help you identify key attributes of your organization and program. select each button to explore the key attributes of kai's program. who are you?where are you located? who are you?where are you located? who are you?where are you located? who are you?where are you located? who are you?where are you located? what will vista members do? what will vista members do? what will vista members do? what will vista members do? what will vista members do? why is this work important? why is this work important? why is this work important? why is this work important? why is this work important? who is eligible? how do they apply? who is eligible? how do they apply? who is eligible? how do they apply? who is eligible? how do they apply? who is eligible? how do they apply?

interpersonal skills cultural competency, personal communication style, and collaboration skills are important qualities for candidates to possess. interpersonal skills initiative candidates who take initiative and work independently, as well as those who set challenging goals, will be well suited for the demands of the vista project. initiative personal responsibility candidates with honesty, integrity, follow-through, self-control, and empathy are more likely to take personal responsibility for their work. personal responsibility adaptability and flexibility curiosity, a willingness to explore new ideas and strategies, and the ability to deal with ambiguity are important qualities for candidates to possess. adaptability and flexibility leadership candidates with a positive attitude, the ability to influence others to act, and the ability to manage change will be better equipped to lead their team. leadership willingness to learn candidates who pursue lifelong learning will be betterequipped to handle the demands of the vista project. candidates who pursue lifelong learning will be betterequipped to handle the demands of the vista project. interpersonal skills cultural great ideas! a few examples of responsibilities a candidate in your project may have to perform include: project planning, cultural competence, leadership, and data management. select the x icon to continue. x x x x x x enter your text here to best understand the attributes a candidate will need for your project, you must consider the position’s responsibilities. identify the top three responsibilities that a candidate for your project will have to perform. enter your response below and select submit to continue.

great ideas! you many have considered some of the most desired competencies such as the following: time management, flexibility, and communication skills. select the x icon to continue. x x x x x x enter your text here with the role’s responsibilities outlined, identify the top three characteristics that a strong candidate will need to meet these responsibilities and perform the role successfully. enter your reflection below and select submit to continue.

select the < icon to review information. benefits of serving as a vista member include: segal americorps education award (education award), stipend and healthcare benefits, professional development, personal growth, and networking opportunities. identify vista service benefits listing the unique benefits of vista service in your recruitment message is important because it helps differentiate service from a job. listing vista service benefits is also important because it provides a clearer understanding of the vista service role and experience. select the > icon to view more information.

the recruitment message identifies the professional growth opportunities the vista member can expect to gain in this role. x x x x x x this portion of the recruitment messages emphasizes the personal attributes the project is looking for in their vista member. x x x x x x review kai’s recruitment message below. select the underlined text to review the key components he included. select the ^ icons to review information. this opportunity will help you enhance your resume, develop your leadership skills, and make a lasting impact on your community. to be eligible for this unique opportunity, you must be at least 18 years old and a us citizen, national, or legal resident. you must also be able to successfully complete a background investigation. join us in our mission to end hunger and promote food justice. to learn more about our organization and apply, please visit my americorps. select the ^ and ú icons for more information. review kai’s recruitment message below. select the underlined text to review the key components he included. join our cause and make a lasting difference in our community. in addition to creating a meaningful impact, volunteering with telegraph community food bank as a vista member will provide you with invaluable skills and experience in community engagement and nonprofit management. review kai’s recruitment message below. select the underlined text to review the key components he included. select the ^ and ú icons for more information. telegraph community food bank is looking for a flexible self-starter to serve as an americorps member in our vista program. you will have the opportunity to make a real impact in our community, and your tasks will include expanding our food distribution network and raising awareness about hunger and food insecurity in oakland and by promoting food justice and equity. telegraph community food bank is looking for a flexible self-starter to serve as an americorps member in our vista program. you will have the opportunity to make a real impact in our community, and your tasks will include expanding our food distribution network and raising awareness about hunger and food insecurity in oakland and by promoting food justice and equity. example recruitment message select the ú icons to view more information. review kai’s recruitment message below. select the underlined text to review the key components he included. located in the heart of oakland, california, telegraph community food bank is a nonprofit organization committed to ending hunger in our community. we achieve our mission by providing nutritious meals to families and individuals in need by promoting food justice and equity.

recap when you begin your recruitment message, review the sponsor-provided service opportunity listing in egrants to get valuable information about your organization and what candidates can expect. along with those details, it’s good practice to include in your message the position’s important attributes, eligibility criteria, and benefits.

select the < icon to review information. review how kai adapted his recruitment message for social media: check out this exciting opportunity to make a real impact in the oakland community! as a vista member with telegraph community food bank, you'll expand our food distribution network and raise awareness about hunger. #foodjustice #endhunger apply now at my americorps. image placeholder #17 image placeholder #17 review how kai adapted his recruitment message for social media: select the < icon to review information. https://my.americorps.gov/mp/login.do https://my.americorps.gov/mp/login.do https://my.americorps.gov/mp/login.do telegraph community food bank tweet that reads: check out this exciting opportunity to make a real impact in the oakland community! as a vista member with telegraph community food bank, you’ll expand our food distribution network and raise awareness about hunger. apply now! htts://my americorps.gov/mp/login.do #foodjustice #endhunger social media recruitment select the cards below for some tips you can use to tailor your recruitment message for social media. select the > icon to view more information. use attention-grabbing headlines and images to draw people in use attention-grabbing headlines and images to draw people in keep messages brief and to the point keep messages brief and to the point use hashtags to increase visibility use hashtags to increase visibility share stories and testimonials from current or past vista members to give potential recruits a better idea of what to expect share stories and testimonials from current or past vista members to give potential recruits a better idea of what to expect sponsors can reach a wider range of candidates by tailoring their message for various formats, such as social media platforms and in-person or virtual recruitment events.

create a 30-secondverbal message use a friendly and welcoming tone highlight the benefits and opportunities available to vista members encourage applicants to apply at my americorps select the < icon to review information. select the speaker icon to listen to kai’s in-person recruitment message. select the speaker icon to replay kai’sin-person recruitment message. select the speaker icon to listen to kai’s in-person recruitment message. image placeholder #19 (kai character in community setting) in-person recruitment select the icons below for some tips for tailoring your recruitment message for an in-person event. select the > icon to view more information.

college students highlight the education award as a benefit of serving in your vista project. additionally, describe the available professional development opportunities your project offers. career changers emphasize the education award as a benefit of serving in your vista project. in addition, highlight how the skills and experience gained through vista service can be applied to a career change. retirees include examples of how retirees have served in your vista project or in the vista program in general. highlight how vista service can provide a meaningful way to give back and continue making an impact in their communities by using their professional expertise. retirees retirees retirees retirees retirees career changers career changers career changers career changers career changers college students college students college students college students college students tailoring your message sponsors can widen their net of potential candidates by tailoring the recruitment message for different formats and for different audiences. select each tab to learn more. then, select next to continue.

the recruitment message describes the professional skills the accepted candidate will develop through this vista position. x x x x x x select the ^ icons to review information. review the recruitment message kai drafted for career changers below. select the underlined text to review the key components he included. to apply for this position, you must be a us citizen, national, or legal resident and able to successfully complete a background investigation. the accepted candidate can expect to demonstrate their adaptability, improve their communication through outreach, and develop their leadership skills as they expand the food distribution network. don't miss out on this chance to start a fulfilling new career; join the mission to end hunger and promote food justice. apply now at my americorps. to apply for this position, you must be a us citizen, national, or legal resident and able to successfully complete a background investigation. the accepted candidate can expect to demonstrate their adaptability, improve their communication through outreach, and develop their leadership skills as they expand the food distribution network. don't miss out on this chance to start a fulfilling new career; join the mission to end hunger and promote food justice. apply now at my americorps. the recruitment message highlights how the education award can apply to expenses relevant to career changers. x x x x x x select the ^ and ú icons for more information. review the recruitment message kai drafted for career changers below. select the underlined text to review the key components he included. serving as a vista member with the telegraph community food bank is an opportunity to gain invaluable skills in community engagement and nonprofit management while making a lasting impact on your community. in addition to the opportunity to positively impact your community, americorps members receive several benefits including an education award that applies to educational expenses and qualified student loan repayment. example recruitment message for career changers select the ú icons to view more information. review the recruitment message kai drafted for career changers below. select the underlined text to review the key components he included. seeking a career change that makes a difference? look no further than telegraph community food bank in oakland, california! as a vista member, you'll develop and implement strategies to expand the food distribution network, promote food justice and equity, and raise awareness about hunger and food insecurity in oakland.

great ideas! here is an example of how this message might be tailored to a career changer: are you looking for a career change that allows you to make a meaningful impact in your community? are you seeking an opportunity to build new professional skills and get hands-on experience in the nonprofit sector? if so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! select the x icon to continue. x x x x x x enter your text here how would you revise this recruitment message opening to target an individual who is in the process of changing their career? enter your reflection below and select submit to continue. read the recruitment message below and then respond to the following question. are you passionate about serving your community and making a difference in the lives of others? do you have a strong desire to gain professional development and hands-on experience in the nonprofit sector? if so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

inclusive recruitment tips here are some strategies for seeking out a diverse pool of applicants: post the message in different community locations, engage with local community leaders, use inclusive language in your recruitment messages, and highlight the organization’s commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

let’s put the pieces together check your understanding of the strategies shared in this course by reviewing the following example. consider how the message could be improved, then select the best response to the questions at the end of the example. select next to begin.

certain audience? are you passionate about ensuring that every child can learn and thrive? are you seeking a change that allows you to connect with others and share your enthusiasm for community service and literacy? if so, join us at readers of tomorrow as an americorps vista member! we are a nonprofit organization based in town, usa, dedicated to improving the reading skills of immigrant children ages 5-11. we are seeking a motivated, outgoing individual to join our team as a marketing and communications vista member. in this role, you will rely on your skillset to find creative ways to increase our visibility within the community and increase our financial resources. navigate through the text below to read a recruitment message shared by a fellow vista sponsor and then respond to the questions that follow. select the > icon to view more information.

this course introduced you to some key components of a strategic vista recruitment message, to help you: craft an effective recruitment message, attract great potential applicants, and find the right candidate for your vista project. building your understanding: closing comments

check out these resources a guide to inclusive recruitment for employers review this comprehensive recruitment guide for recommended actions throughout the interview process. want to learn more? actively addressing unconscious bias in recruiting this resource highlights unconscious bias, and how organizations can – and should – address it in recruitment. social media recruiting: a complete guide (with examples) learn about the benefits and process of creating a social media marketing strategy.

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:
